definition: lit. the path exhausted, the end of the road (idiom); an impasse/in a plight with no way out/things have reached a dead end
poor/destitute/to use up/to exhaust/thoroughly/extremely/(coll.) persistently and pointlessly
way/route/road
tip/end/final stage/latter part/inessential detail/powder/dust/opera role of old man
surname Lu
road/CL:條|条[tiao2]/journey/route/line (bus etc)/sort/kind

sentences.english: The sailor who had lost everything by shipwreck said that he was thrown on his beam-ends .
sentences.chinese: 这位在海难中失去一切的水手说，他已经穷途末路了。

sentences.english: Manouchehr Takin, do you agree that the nuclear renaissance is at an end?
sentences.chinese: 你认为核工业复兴会穷途末路吗？

sentences.english: This does not mean that ambition is at an end.
sentences.chinese: 这并不意味着雄心已到了穷途末路。

definition: mountain and river exhausted (idiom); at the end of the line/nowhere to go
end of the road/final road/fig. dead end/impasse
to be at an impasse (idiom)/in a tight spot/at the end of one's rope/desperate
sunset, the end of the road (idiom); in terminal decline/at a dead end
lit. people rebelling and friends deserting (idiom)/fig. to find oneself utterly isolated
lit. on all sides, the songs of Chu (idiom)/fig. surrounded by enemies, isolated and without help
a cornered beast will still fight (idiom)/to fight like an animal at bay
desperate straits
without a retreat route/caught in a dead end/having burned one's bridges
to exhaust one's limited abilities (idiom)
failed and wiped over the floor (idiom); to fail utterly/a crushing defeat/beaten and in a hopeless position
troops in defeat like a landslide (idiom); a beaten army in total collapse
precarious as pile of eggs (idiom); ready to fall and break at any moment/in a dangerous state
to stake all on one throw
to be facing imminent calamity (idiom)/disaster is looming
fall (of an empire)
